intro: Impatiens racemulosa, commonly known as the clustered impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Impatiens racemulosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
